data.title: A sweet taste of Italy in NW Indiana
data.text: This place is small and lacks curb appeal but dont pass it up. They have a variety of flavors, including tropical ones. Perfect for cooling off in this recent heat wave. And the taste is as good (perhaps better) than the Italian ice you find in Chicago.

data.title: Best cold sweet treat around!
data.text: This is Jodi's original location and it's a little "hole in the wall" that houses the heaven of fresh homemade Italian ice. Generous portions of fresh fruit flavors, candy flavors, and various other snacks and treats make this a fun stop. Family owned with Jodi as the creative genius behind innovative flavors. I'm not a relative or friend, just an addicted customer who has been coming with my kids from their first weeks in business. Now going to their new Munster location since it's closer, and it has great outdoor seating. I'll take their Italian ice over ice cream every day!

data.title: Swedish Fish Flavored Italian Ice!
data.text: Jodi's Italian Ice Factory serves freshly made, sweet, creamy Italian Ice (closer to gelato than shaved ice) in about 15 different flavors. They offer traditional flavors like lemon, strawberry, cherry, and blue raspberry but also unusual flavors like green apple, root beer  and Swedish Fish. Prices are very reasonable: $2.50 for a small (probably 6 oz), $3.00 for medium and $3.50 for a large. The building is very modest and painted plain white. There are a few chairs and a bench inside but no tables. The air conditioning was running and the shop was cool. There is a large driveway and a medium  sized parking lot behind the building. It would be nice to have some picnic tables or benches outside. Located just north of I-80 and just south of 173rd Street on the west side of Calumet/ US 41, it is very convenient for quick stops.

data.title: Jodi's
data.text: They offer a variety of flavors of italian ice! I love,the mango  or cherry! The staff is,family and are very warm! Prices are about $3 per cup but worth it! Very very tasty!

data.title: Delicious Italian Ice
data.text: I'm late in reviewing, but the wonderful flavor left an imprint on my brain.  I was able to sample before my purchase, but went with a cherry and lime combo.  It was sooooo tasty.  The server was very helpful and friendly.  I thought it to be a little pricey, but I didn't have other experience on which to base on, so I wasn't sure what to expect.  I'm remembering around $4.  But the flavor was wonderful, so when I want to splurge a little, I'll stop in again next time I'm in town.
